channel.title: Dev Culture on Preslav Rachev
channel.description: Recent content in Dev Culture on Preslav Rachev

item.title: Good Code is Boring
item.description: You have seen them many times. Small snippets of code and the question “What would the the following piece of code print” beneath. You might have tried taking a guess, and perhaps, even failed. {{ tweet “865159346149314560”}} I find those kinds of questions utterly pointless. They not only teach you nothing about real-world programming, but might also lead many newcomers to long-term frustration with programming. All programming languages have baggage - obscure features that made it in the spec but were later deemed as hacks that should be avoided.

item.title: Give Me Back My Monolith
item.description: Give me back my monolith It feels like we’re starting to pass the peak of the hype cycle of microservices. It’s no longer multiple times a week we now see a blog … Source: - http://www.craigkerstiens.com Give Me Back My Monolith by Craig Kerstiens is something I have been ranting about for quite some time. It is thus good to see other people standing on the same side of the bridge:
